Dexcom Studio is incompatable with Windows 8?!?!?!

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎01-09-2014 05:26 PM

I got a new computer this past week.  Today I downloaded the dex studio from the dex website, but it won't recognize my receiver.  I called tech support and was told that it is not compatable with Windows8.  How could they have had such an oversight?  Wasn't Windows 8 already out when the Dex Studio came out?  If not, it wasn't long after.  The lady at tech support said that they are working on a new software that is compatable, and it is in trials now.  She doesn't know when it will be ready for release.

 

In the meantime, those of us who have Windows 8 have no way to use the software.  What an unpleasant surprise!  Has anybody else learned this the hard way?

 

I could use the Animas Ping software.  I never have before because I love the dex software so much.  I am not really looking forward to the adjustment.  It is better than nothing, though!

gb2847
Diagnosed with Diabetes Type 2 by mistake --1/26/11
Diagnosed correctly with Type 1-- 4/5/11 (just before 47th birthday)
using OmniPod pump and Dexcom cgm
Also have Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy, Hashimoto's Thyroiditis, Asthma, Osteo Arthritis, Osteo Pinea, Gastroparesis, GERD, Hypersensitivity to irritants in environment (lungs, eyes), and Severe Obstructive Sleep Apnea

Helpful Response Given! Go to this response.

‎01-09-2014 07:20 PM

That's right.  When I first got my Windows 8 laptop, I found out like you that Dexcom is compatible.  Which was ok, because my husband had a laptop with Windows 7.  When that  died, he got a new laptop with Windows 8 and I was back to square one.  I also called Dexcom, and was told the software was written for Windows 7.  She said when they fix it they will post it on the website.  I really miss it and don't want to go back to the OmniPod software because I do fingersticks so infrequently now.



-Sue
Type 1, diagnosed at age 38
OmniPod pump using Apidra insulin
Dexcom CGM

My adult son was diagnosed type 1 at age 4
MiniMed Revel pump and CGM
Apidra insulin

‎01-10-2014 05:03 AM

I don't use that software so I have no way to test this myself but have you tried running that program in compatibility mode?

 

Right click on the program file, the one with .exe as the extension, or right click on your shortcut for it. Select Properties, select the tab titled Compatibility,

 

There you can either click on Run compatibility troubleshooter, OR, just check the box under Compatibility mode below that which says, Run this program in compatibility mode for, then click on the arrow for the drop down list below that and select whatever operating system you know it has worked in. I would start with the newest OS first.

 

My preferred method is to not run the troubleshooter unless the second method mentioned above does not work.

 

This may or may not work, but it cannot hurt.

 

Good luck

Gia,

Trisha

IDDM (Type 1 Autoimmune) 30+ many more years ~ Currently using MDI & Minimed CGM ~
Check out my diabetes blog!

All brittle means, is that one has great fluctuations, which is pretty much hallmark for Type 1's. Some more so than others. - me

First light brings a new day, new hope, new wisdom, and a chance to start fresh again. - me

If everyone were dealt the same amount of cards, there would be no challenges in life. Challenges are part of life's lessons, to teach us to grow in all aspects, and to learn what we need to learn, to make it in this world. Life was not meant to be fair. -me

"WE, the PEOPLE....."

~ New Type 1 Info ~ Insulin, Test Strips, Lancets, and other meds ~ Kidney Damage Info ~



*****************
Sidenote to new members....please put which type of diabetes you have, in your signature area. T1's and T2's cross post on these forums, and it is imperative that we all know which type one is. This is so that no misinformation is given to anyone. Type 1 and Type 2 are two totally absolute different diseases with different causes, thus making self-management very different. Thank you!, and welcome to the forums.
*****************

I just went to dexcom.com and downloaded the software and it installed just fine.  Am I missing something?  Is it how it works after installation?  The device driver also installed fine.  I was able to boot the application successfully too. 


Unfortunately, I couldn't run any tests as I don't have a dexcom cgm.

 

I am using Windows 8.1, which could be the difference.  If you don't have windows 8.1, you can go to the Windows App store and download it for free.  (I recommend upgrading regardless as the update has needed improvements)

 

Feel free to send me a PM if you are having trouble, I can try and help.

‎01-15-2014 08:52 PM - edited ‎01-15-2014 08:56 PM

It's also incompatible with OSX (apple)  so it's useless to me.  I've asked them but doesn't sound like they are about to.

 

I got a windows machine JUST FOR DEXCOM....  and I'm sorry but it's very problematic (windows and the machine, and the "Studio"

 

Though the concept is fantastic to be able to analyse the data from my CGM.....   I have high end apple gear with which I'm familiar and never have to call a technician, or tech support, haven't had one "crash" in over a decade....  and would really appreciate a CGM that would cooperate with my computers...  like Tandem Diabetes and my pump.  No problems....  lots of great information, very helpful and useful.  

 

Rumor was; Dexcom and Tandem (TSlim pump) were joining together where the TSlim would also be the reciever and everyone was working the same language and data, and more sleek.  Diabetic friends and helpers were hearing that it was likely by the end of 2013.  So there may be hope there, for folks in my situation; though that doesn't speak directly to your frustration with windows.

 

We should be able to say "THERES AN AP FOR THAT".

 

 

 

 

 

 

Best, to you
Endo said my case behaves like T1, since about age 50, idiopathic: toxicological, or immune mediated. first dx T2 in 2008 by my GP
Now limiting complications via TSlim pump w/Novalog .... Dexcom
